div.p: Section A–C showing the lithostratigraphy of the Cudmore Grove channel-fill sequence and overlying sands and gravels (Unit 6). The location of the boreholes is shown in Fig. 3. The position of Unit 3, only a few centimetres thick, at the base of the organic sequence (depicted in black) is indicated. The stratigraphical position of this unit is shown more clearly in Fig. 5. The lateral continuity of sub-units 2c and 2d near boreholes MM6–MM7 is unclear; here the Pleistocene beds are replaced by Holocene estuarine deposits ( Fig. 3) which are compositionally similar to the upper part of the Pleistocene channel-fill sequence and locally indistinguishable. Samples for clast lithological analysis ( Table 1) were collected from the cliff sections near borehole CG1 (sampling points a, b, c).
